title: Who are the most influential German intellectuals of the 19th century? - Quora

response.answer_text: For most of the 19th century, Germany wasn't a country but was clearly a force on the intellectual and political landscape.  Much of the 20th century was influenced by Germans of the 19th.  Karl Marx.  Wrote a little piece called the Communist Manifesto, 1848.Friedrich Nietzsche.  Wrote: God is Dead.Johann Wolfgang von Goethe. Was the first Quoran.  Wrote intelligently about everything.Brothers Grimm: created a world for children by collecting and publishing fairy tales.Werner von Siemens;  Invented everything from the stop lights to telegraph pointers. Laid first transatlantic cable.Ludwig van Beethoven.  Symphonic genius. This is just my starter list.
